ovdesc.p: This is the internal file which contains details of all Profit and Loss entries.
Entries are generated in this file by every on-line and batch process which involves debiting or crediting Profit and Loss.
This file is used by any process which needs details of Profit and Loss entries.
Only the See, Print and List functions may be used in this Application.

Denotes whether forward entries should be cycled to the next working day when the value date on the entry is reached.

Some applications may raise forward entries with a value date, but no processing may occur on the value date. For example a Fiduciary order, a security order or a Past Due record. It is important for these application to leave the entry as the impact on the cash-flow is required for the account. In these cases the value of this field should be set to Y, which will cause the date to cyled every night instead of being removed.

Other applications such as LD, Swaps and Bond Processing in securities, allow adjustment of the value date on non-working days, so that it is possible to get a back dated entry for an event to be processed in the future. For these situations thisi field can contain the date on which the event is to be processed, amd therefore the date the forward entry expires. The system will cycle such entries forward when the value date is less than the system date until the expiry date is reached.

A unique key by which the Entry may be identified. It is generated by the system, based on the date, system user number and time (in hundredths of a second) at which the transaction is input and a sequence number.
The key is made up as follows:
(a) 5 digit date expressed as the number of days since 31st December 1967.
(b) 5 digit user number, the system user number of the inputter First introduced in G8.1.00
(c) Time in seconds since midnight, consisting of 5 integers and (usually) 2 decimals. If the time is an exact number of seconds since midnight, the decimals are omitted.
(d) Sequence number.
If a transaction generates several Entries, all the Entries have parts (a), (b) and (c) the same and are distinguished from each other by their Sequence numbers.

A multivalue field linking together all the Statement Entry records and Category Entry records generated at the same time by the same transaction/ deal.
The keys to the Statement Entry file and the Category Entry file are made up of 2 parts, Statement Number and Sequence Number.
If a transaction generates several Entries, all the Entries have the same Statement Number, the Entries on the same file are distinguished from each other by their Sequence Numbers.
The Statement Number consists of:
1. 4 digit date expressed as the number of days since 31st December 1967.
2. Time in seconds since midnight, consisting of 5 integers and (usually) 2 decimals. If the time is an exact number of seconds since midnight, the decimals are omitted.
The Sequence number is a 4 digit number from 0001 to 9999.
Every Entry generated by the same transaction/deal has the same values in fields 26.1 to 26.3.
Field 26.1 contains the Statement Number which is the first part of the key for all the Statement Entries and Category Entries.
Field 26.2 contains the range of Sequence Numbers used for the Statement Entries. If there are no Statement Entries, this field will contain null.
Field 26.3 contains the range of Sequence Numbers used for the Category Entries. If there are no Category Entries, this field will contain null.
Example : If a transaction processed on 3rd June 1986 at 30.5 seconds after 11.15 a.m. generates 3 Statement Entries and 2 Category Entries -
The Statement Number is 672940530.50 made up as follows -
Date 6729 Time 40530.50
The Entries generated have the following Ids -
Statement Entries Category Entries
All the Entries have the following values in Fields 26.1 to 26.3 -
Field 26.1 672940530.50 Field 26.2 1-3 (3 Statement Entries) Field 26.3 1-2 (2 Category Entries)

a) Field 26.1 STATEMENT NUMBER 9 integers and (usually) 2 decimals. b) Field 26.2 range of STATEMENT ENTRY SEQUENCE NUMBERS. Up to 5 numeric characters with '-' after the first. c) Field 26.3 range of CATEGORY ENTRY SEQUENCE NUMBERS. Up to 5 numeric characters with '-' after the first. Internal file.

The suspense category to be used for split value dated transactions.

This category code is derived from the SUS.CATEGORY in the ACCOUNT.PARAMETER file for the PRODUCT.CATEGORY of the entry being suspensed.
